results.title: Pressing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Preserving and Drying of Plant Material”.
One of three films dealing with different aspects of preserving and drying of plant material, showing the techniques and everyday domestic equipment needed to achieve satisfactory results. This film deals with preservation by pressing.
results.description:

results.title: Press Gang
results.creator_credit: Sandra C. Hastie, Steven Moffat, Martin Childs and Christopher Edwards
results.brief_description: Press Gang was a British children’s comedy-drama revolving around the staff at The Junior Gazette, a childrens weekly newspaper produced by a group of school pupils.

constellations_other.name: News on location
constellations_other.description: The Pye Orthicon is an example of the type of television cameras used from the 1950s in Australia for both studio and outside broadcast work. Such cameras did not have have the capacity to record while out on location and so outside crews would transmit vision and sound back to studios for recording or live broadcast.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra C. Hastie, Steven Moffat, Martin Childs and Christopher Edwards
results.description:
Press Gang was a British children’s comedy-drama revolving around the staff at The Junior Gazette, a childrens weekly newspaper produced by a group of school pupils.

The show interspersed comedic elements with the dramatic, tackling issues such as solvent abuse, child abuse and firearms control.
description_for_label:

The show interspersed comedic elements with the dramatic, tackling issues such as solvent abuse, child abuse and firearms control.

results.title: Presidential tour
results.brief_description: The President of the U.S.A., Lyndon B. Johnson, and Mrs. Johnson visit Australia in October, 1966. Scenes in Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane and Townsville.

results.title: President Soeharto in Australia, February 1972
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Indonesian President and his wife are seen arriving at Canberra, and at official functions in Parliament House, the Australian War Memorial, the Melbourne Arts Centre, Mary Mead Children’s Home, Taronga Zoo, the new Indonesian Chancery and other points of interest.

results.title: President Kennedy in Ireland, June 26-29, 1963
results.brief_description: Made by Irish Television, this is an account of President John F. Kennedy’s visit to Ireland in June 1963. It is a straight record of President Kennedy’s return to the land of his forefathers - we see the welcoming ceremony, the motorcade through the streets of Dublin, visits to other principal cities and the informal visit to the family home.

results.title: Preserving the Wasa
results.creator_credit: Michael Heckford, Douglas Gordon and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the location and salvaging of the Swedish warship Wasa which sank on its maiden voyage in Stockholm harbour in 1628. Explains the use of the petroleum product Polythlene glycol in the preservation of the wood of the Wasa. It diffuses through the wood cells - forcing out the water and sets hard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Heckford, Douglas Gordon and Shell Film Unit
results.description: An account of the location and salvaging of the Swedish warship Wasa which sank on its maiden voyage in Stockholm harbour in 1628. results.title: Preserving our national heritage
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Reese, Balm Paints and Cine Service
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the work of the National Trust and affiliated bodies. Describes how they are preserving, marking and in some cases making available to the public in various states, Australia’s historic buildings, Aboriginal relics, and rare native flora and fauna. Narrated by John Royle.
